definition: to conceal oneself/to go into hiding/to take cover
to conceal/to hide away/to harbor/to store/to collect

sentences.english: Some have to hide eking out a living for decades.
sentences.chinese: 有些老華僑甚至躲藏了數十年，偷偷謀生。

sentences.english: The escaped prisoner was dragged out of his hiding-place.
sentences.chinese: 逃犯從他躲藏的地方給拉了出來。

sentences.english: Are you hiding away, lost Under the sewers.
sentences.chinese: 你不斷的在躲藏嗎，是遺落在陰溝之下。

sentences.english: I was restless, I lived and worked, hiding all the time.
sentences.chinese: 我一直躲躲藏藏地生活和工作着，心裏很緊張。

sentences.english: You cannot hide behind your company’s walls anymore.
sentences.chinese: 你再不能躲藏在公司大牆之後。

sentences.english: Many giants were killed by Aurors and the rest fled into hiding for the next fifteen years.
sentences.chinese: 許多巨人被傲羅殺死，其餘的逃走，躲藏了十五年。

sentences.english: Bats tend to hide in dark caves.
A man who is fleeing never thinks himself sufficiently hidden.
sentences.chinese: 逃匿的人總以爲自己躲藏的地方不夠隱蔽。

sentences.english: Said two hairs secretly escape break temple, dark lonely hiding and pick the technical secondary school.
sentences.chinese: 卻說二毛偷偷逃出破廟，黑暗中專挑偏僻處躲藏而去。

sentences.english: Fearing the authorities, Eric remained in hiding after the war.
sentences.chinese: 埃裏克害怕政府當局，戰後他一直躲藏着。

sentences.english: On the surface, the German Fleet was hiding in its snuggeries.
sentences.chinese: 表面來看，德國艦隊躲藏在老窩裏。

sentences.english: Jeyne had pulled the furs up over herself to hide.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮將皮毛拉到頭頂以躲藏。

sentences.english: Col. Gadhafi and his son Seif are in hiding.
sentences.chinese: 卡扎菲和兒子賽義夫仍在躲藏。

sentences.english: Maybe I can understand WHY you acted underhand.
sentences.chinese: 也許我能理解，你爲何如此躲躲藏藏。

sentences.english: The bearers, shaking in terror, hide themselves in the thorny bush.
sentences.chinese: 轎伕們，怕得發抖，躲藏在荊棘叢中。

sentences.english: Love autumn leaves painted youth, love dream Yin with hide sadness.
sentences.chinese: 愛的秋葉描畫了青春，情的夢吟點綴了躲藏的悲涼。

definition: to hide/to go into hiding/to take refuge
to cover up/to conceal/to go into hiding
to run away/to flee in disarray
to hide/to evade/to dodge/to take shelter/to avoid (difficulties)
to hunt and arrest (fugitives)/to track down and arrest/a manhunt
to flee from sth/to run away/to escape
